actor_awards.notes: Won Best Director Oscar for 'Ordinary People' (1980); received Honorary Oscar in 2002.

filmography.title: War Hunt
filmography.role_description: An idealistic private in the Korean War who tries to stop a fellow soldier's descent into madness; Redford's feature film debut.
filmography.plot: A new recruit in the Korean War tries to help a psychotic soldier who has been killing enemy soldiers at night.

filmography.title: Inside Daisy Clover
filmography.role_description: A charming but closeted movie star who marries the title character, a teenage singing sensation.
filmography.plot: A teenage tomboy is discovered by a Hollywood producer and turned into a star, but the studio system threatens to destroy her.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – New Star of the Year

filmography.title: The Chase
filmography.role_description: An escaped convict whose return to his hometown exposes the corruption and vice of its residents.
filmography.plot: The escape of Bubber Reeves from prison affects the inhabitants of a small Southern town.

filmography.title: This Property Is Condemned
filmography.role_description: A railroad official sent to a small Mississippi town to lay off workers, where he falls for the town flirt.
filmography.plot: A railroad official comes to a Mississippi town to shut down the railway yard and becomes involved with a local woman.

filmography.title: Barefoot in the Park
filmography.role_description: A stiff, conservative lawyer trying to adjust to married life with his free-spirited wife in a tiny New York apartment.
filmography.plot: A conservative young lawyer and his free-spirited bride try to adapt to married life in a tiny Greenwich Village apartment.

filmography.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
filmography.role_description: The quiet, deadly sharpshooter of the Hole-in-the-Wall Gang who flees to Bolivia with his partner.
filmography.plot: Wyoming outlaws Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid get on the wrong side of the law and must go on the run.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Win – Best Actor; National Film Registry (Inducted 2003)

filmography.title: Downhill Racer
filmography.role_description: A talented but self-centered alpine skier who joins the U.S. ski team and alienates his teammates.
filmography.plot: A skier joins the United States ski team and clashes with the coach while trying to make it to the Olympics.

filmography.title: Tell Them Willie Boy Is Here
filmography.role_description: A reluctant sheriff in 1909 California who hunts a Native American fugitive, understanding the tragedy of the situation.
filmography.plot: A Native American man runs from the law after killing his girlfriend's father in self-defense, pursued by a sheriff.

filmography.title: Jeremiah Johnson
filmography.role_description: A mountain man who seeks a solitary life in the Rockies but finds himself entangled in a vendetta with the Crow tribe.
filmography.plot: A Mexican-American War veteran heads to the mountains to live in isolation, but must fight for his survival.

filmography.title: The Candidate
filmography.role_description: An idealistic lawyer who runs for the U.S. Senate and slowly compromises his values to win.
filmography.plot: Bill McKay is a candidate for the U.S. Senate from California. He has no chance of winning, so he is allowed to say what he thinks.

filmography.title: The Way We Were
filmography.role_description: A handsome, privileged writer who enters a tumultuous, decades-spanning romance with a fiery political activist.
filmography.plot: Two desperate people have a wonderful romance, but their political views and convictions drive them apart.

filmography.title: The Sting
filmography.role_description: A small-time grifter who teams up with a master con artist to take down a vicious mob boss.
filmography.plot: Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: The Great Gatsby
filmography.role_description: The enigmatic millionaire who throws lavish parties in the 1920s hoping to win back his lost love, Daisy.
filmography.plot: A Midwesterner becomes fascinated with his nouveau riche neighbor, who obsesses over his lost love.

filmography.title: Three Days of the Condor
filmography.role_description: A CIA researcher who finds his co-workers murdered and must go on the run to uncover a conspiracy.
filmography.plot: A mild-mannered CIA researcher finds all his co-workers dead, and must outwit those responsible until he figures out who he can really trust.

filmography.title: All the President's Men
filmography.role_description: The persistent Washington Post reporter who, along with Carl Bernstein, investigates the Watergate scandal.
filmography.plot: The Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Nixon's resignation.

filmography.title: A Bridge Too Far
filmography.role_description: A heroic American paratrooper commander who leads the daring crossing of the Waal river under heavy fire.
filmography.plot: Operation Market Garden, September 1944: The Allies attempt to capture several strategically important bridges in the Netherlands.

filmography.title: The Electric Horseman
filmography.role_description: A retired rodeo champion turned cereal spokesman who steals a valuable horse to set it free.
filmography.plot: A former rodeo star is hired to be the spokesman for a cereal company, but runs off with their prize horse to release it into the wild.

filmography.title: Brubaker
filmography.role_description: A new prison warden who goes undercover as an inmate to expose corruption and abuse within the system.
filmography.plot: The new warden of a small prison farm in Arkansas tries to clean it up of corruption after initially posing as an inmate.

filmography.title: The Natural
filmography.role_description: A middle-aged baseball player with a mysterious past who makes a comeback with a bat carved from a lightning-struck tree.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged unknown comes out of nowhere to become a legendary baseball player with almost supernatural talent.

filmography.title: Out of Africa
filmography.role_description: A free-spirited big-game hunter who becomes the lover of Karen Blixen in colonial Kenya.
filmography.plot: In 20th-century colonial Kenya, a Danish baroness / plantation owner has a passionate love affair with a free-spirited big-game hunter.

filmography.title: Sneakers
filmography.role_description: The leader of a team of security experts who are blackmailed into stealing a powerful code-breaking device.
filmography.plot: A security pro finds his past coming back to haunt him, when he and his unique team are tasked with retrieving a particularly important item.

filmography.title: Indecent Proposal
filmography.role_description: A billionaire who offers a young couple one million dollars for a night with the wife.
filmography.plot: A billionaire offers one million dollars to a young married couple for one night with the wife.

filmography.title: The Horse Whisperer
filmography.role_description: A horse trainer with a unique gift who helps a traumatized girl and her horse heal; also directed by Redford.
filmography.plot: The mother of a severely traumatized daughter enlists the aid of a unique horse trainer to help the girl's equally injured horse.

filmography.title: Spy Game
filmography.role_description: A retiring CIA operative who uses all his skills and resources to rescue his former protégé from a Chinese prison.
filmography.plot: Retiring CIA agent Nathan Muir recalls his training of Tom Bishop while working against agency politics to free him from his Chinese captors.

filmography.title: All Is Lost
filmography.role_description: A solo sailor who must fight for survival against the elements after his boat is damaged in the Indian Ocean.
filmography.plot: After a collision with a shipping container at sea, a resourceful sailor finds himself, despite all efforts to the contrary, staring his mortality in the face.
filmography.awards: NYFCC: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor

filmography.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
filmography.role_description: A senior S.H.I.E.L.D. official who is revealed to be a high-ranking Hydra leader.
filmography.plot: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D. agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat.

filmography.title: The Old Man & the Gun
filmography.role_description: A polite, aging career criminal who continues to rob banks and charm everyone he meets; Redford's final leading role.
filmography.plot: Based on the true story of Forrest Tucker and his audacious escape from San Quentin at the age of 70 to an unprecedented string of heists that confounded authorities and enchanted the public.
